p: Compound 418 was tested for antimicrobial activities against two human pathogens ( E. coli and S. aureus), seven aquatic bacteria ( Aeromonas hydrophila, Edwardsiella tarda, Micrococcus luteus, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Vibrio alginolyticus, Vibrio harveyi, and Vibrio parahaemolyticus). Compound 418 exhibited inhibitory activity against E. coli, and S. aureus with same MIC values of 32 µg/mL. Positive control was chloramphenicol which with MIC values of 2 µg/mL and 1 µg/mL against E. coli, and S. aureus [ 136].
